ChestDBBenchPress.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
ChestDBBenchPress.preparation: Sit down on bench with dumbbells resting on lower thigh. Kick weights to shoulder and lie back. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
ChestDBBenchPress.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
ChestDBBenchPress.comments: Dumbbells should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights  see suggested mount and dismount techniques standard or advanced. Also see mount  dismount from special machine rack and Bench Press Analysis.

ChestDBDeclineBenchPress.name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
ChestDBDeclineBenchPress.preparation: Sit down on decline bench with feet under leg brace and dumbbells resting on thigh. Lie back with dumbbells. Position dumbbells to sides of chest with bent arm under each dumbbell.
ChestDBDeclineBenchPress.execution: Press dumbbells up with elbows to sides until arms are extended. Lower weight to sides of chest until slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulder. Repeat.
ChestDBDeclineBenchPress.comments: Stirrup should follow slight arch pattern, above upper arm between elbow and chest at bottom, traveling inward over each shoulder at top. No need to drop weights  see suggested mount and dismount technique. Latissimus Dorsi involv ement is low on Decline Bench Press (Barnett 1995). Also see mount  dismount from special machine rack and Bench Press Analysis.

ChestDBDeclineFly.name: Dumbbell Decline Fly
ChestDBDeclineFly.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on decline bench. Support dumbbells above upper abdomen with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are to sides.
ChestDBDeclineFly.execution: Lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed. Bring dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.
ChestDBDeclineFly.comments: Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent, and pointing outward, opposite direction of upward motion. Anterior Deltoid will no longer act as synergist in steep decline bench position.

ChestDBFly.name: Dumbbell Fly
ChestDBFly.preparation: Grasp two dumbbells. Lie supine on bench. Support dumbbells above chest with arms fixed in slightly bent position. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows point out to sides.
ChestDBFly.execution: Lower dumbbells to sides until chest muscles are stretched with elbows fixed in slightly bent position. Bring dumbbells together in wide hugging motion until dumbbells are nearly together. Repeat.
ChestDBFly.comments: Keep shoulders internally rotated so elbows point downward at bottom position and outward at top position. Keep elbows at fixed angle, only slightly bent.

ChestDBPullover.name: Dumbbell Pullover
ChestDBPullover.preparation: Lie on upper back perpendicular to bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp one dumbbell from behind or from side with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
ChestDBPullover.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are inline with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.
ChestDBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount  dismount.
ChestDBPullover.synergists: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

ChestDBPulloverAp.name: Dumbbell Pullover (on apparatus)
ChestDBPulloverAp.preparation: Sit on lower pad with back against upper pad, facing dumbbell in rack. Position feet under padded bars. Grasp dumbbell by handle with both hands. Pull top of dumbbell to chest. Push dumbbell up over chest with both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Raise hips up from pad and recline torso back so chest faces upward. Keep hips and elbows slightly bent.
ChestDBPulloverAp.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are inline with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.
ChestDBPulloverAp.comments: Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount  dismount.
ChestDBPulloverAp.synergists: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

ChestDBPulloverArchedBench.name: Dumbbell Pullover (on arched bench)
ChestDBPulloverArchedBench.preparation: Sit on seat of arched bench with dumbbell on lower thigh. Kick dumbbell up to shoulder while lying back on bench. Grasp both hands under inner plate of dumbbell. Position dumbbell over chest with elbows slightly bent.
ChestDBPulloverArchedBench.execution: Keeping elbows slightly bent throughout movement, lower dumbbell over and beyond head until upper arms are inline with torso. Pull dumbbell up and over chest. Repeat.
ChestDBPulloverArchedBench.comments: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. See suggested mount  dismount.
ChestDBPulloverArchedBench.synergists: latissimusdorsi, deltoidposterior, teresmajor, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, pectoralisminor, rhomboids
